newsitem.title: JAPAN: Firm sees Osaka aluminium futures used for hedging.
newsitem.headline: Firm sees Osaka aluminium futures used for hedging.

text.p: A planned aluminium futures contract to be listed on the Osaka Textile Exchange in October is likely to be used for hedging purposes, unlike its Tokyo counterpart, an Osaka-based metal company said on Monday.
The Tokyo Commodity Exchange (TOCOM) launched a yen-based aluminium futures contract in April, and industry officials say speculative orders currently dominate trade there.

"Aluminium firms here may use the Osaka aluminium contract to hedge about 10 to 15 percent of their monthly aluminium demand," Makoto Miyake, the president of Almetax Manufacturing Co Ltd told Reuters.
He said, however, end-users with robust aluminium demand may prefer to use the Tokyo futures market as output there is greater than in Osaka, western Japan.
He said end-users in Osaka consume up to 4,000 tonnes per month.

Asked about the dwindling trade volume in TOCOM aluminium futures, Miyake said that many players have been wary of participating due to fluctuations in the dollar/yen rate and uncertainty of direction in aluminium prices on the London Metal Exchange.
